abstract: The French drugmaker said it believed it had “overwhelming support” from Medivation’s shareholders for a merger, and Medivation still said no.
snippet: The French drugmaker said it believed it had “overwhelming support” from Medivation’s shareholders for a merger, and Medivation still said no.
lead_paragraph: LONDON — The French drug company Sanofi and Medivation, a California company that makes a prostate cancer drug, traded volleys on Thursday in a contentious takeover fight.

headline.main: Sanofi Trades Volleys With Medivation in $9.3 Billion Offer
